name: Hotel Orlanda

reviews.title: Hotel Orlanda and the Happy Travelers
reviews.text: Thanks to Tripadvisor, after much research we selected the Hotel Orlanda for a four night stay in Rome. It was a very warm late June 2004 and for starters the Orlanda had excellent air-conditioning in the rooms! Quite a relief after a day on the town. Back to the beginning, You have to look to find the sign that directs you to the hotel. The usual cramped elevator lifts you to the unassuming entrance. In the small tidy lobby, A young, (as was all of the desk staff) very friendly, english fluent desk attendant checked us in, offering maps and orientation. The rooms (we stayed in two as we returned to the hotel at the end of our trip) would qualify as basic, but were very clean and actually good sized. The mattresses could use a slight upgrade, if one had to find something not quite right. It seems like all the money has gone into the bathrooms which had marble floors, plenty of towels, plenty of hot water, hair dryer and were quite large by European standards. Of course, the view out the window was of the adjoining building and was only picturesque in the laundry on the line with kids playing in Italy kinda way. But we're not in Rome to sit in our hotel! So perhaps the Orlanda's true value is its proximity to the Termini. The subway and any bus to anywhere in the city is only three minutes away, As are trains to anywhere in Europe. Close but not too close as you don't really hear the train activity. (of course, you do have the air-conditioning on. Did I mention it is remote controlled? Just like a tv remote). Once you get the hang of the Metro and buses much of Rome is easily at your command. Location, location, location. There are restaurants in the neighborhood of adequate quality and the streets a bit busy for sidewalk dining, although we did anyway, but remember you're only minutes from transportation to anywhere you want to go and the nice person at the desk will tell you how to get there. Also there is gelato right next door, which, it turns out, is important in summer. One other mention, the hotel breakfast was simple, but fine to start your day and the coffee in the automatic dispenser was actually the best I'd had in years! I'm serious. I don't know what the secret is, but that darn machine did a better cup then a U.S. Starbucks or any other pretender. It reminded me just how good it is to be back in Europe.

What a seedy hotel, location and unfriendly staff. Don't stay in this area of Rome (the few streets near Termini station). It is full of litter, gypseys and vagrants. We felt unsafe and the locked gate for this hotel is full of litter even inside the gate. It looked like a third world ghetto. I have been to Rome about 10 times and this is the worst area I have experienced. Stay anywhere else. We asked if we could get the room priced without breakfast since we had an early morning flight (before they served) and the desk clerk laughed hysterically for 2 minutes...we wondered if he was on drugs. The next morning when we left and we checked out, he smelled really bad. The price was 108 Euro but it should have been more like 50 Euro. At the airport the next day, we heard from other people that they had stayed in this area and felt the same way.
reviews.title: The worst I have ever stayed in!

reviews.text: We went to Rome from 21 april until 24 april. Hotel Orlanda is in the centre of Rome. Only 2 min. walk to Termini station where the metro/bus/trains are and only 15 min. walk tot Colosseum/Forum Romanum. It is in one building (3 and 5 floor) with several other hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location!
Orlanda
reviews.text: The room was good and clean. Be aware of noise from out side. It is not a country side. But never the less we slept good.

reviews.title: Excellent location, clean, roomy, safe, close
reviews.text: Good bathroom and a great shower! A safety deposit box is in the room.

reviews.title: Convenient Location & Friendly Staff
reviews.text: We stayed there March 9 & 10 2004. They have recently renovated the rooms. It is very close to the main train station (Roma Termini) so you can catch a train, subway or bus to anywhere. The staff speaks fluent English and was very friendly, honest and helpful. They recommended a nice restaurant that was close and reasonably priced (Gallena Bianca). It was a nice restaurant 2 blocks from hotel. We enjoyed our meal.For the price this is a great hotel!

reviews.title: a gem
reviews.text: The room was great. Large by European standards. We had a private bath (tiny shower) and bring your own wash cloths. The breakfast isn't much but there's a fabulous little coffee shop (bar) downstairs. The staff was friendly & very helpful. They directed us to several great restaurants & set us up for an overnight stay in Sorrento at another great place. We were there for almost 2 weeks and loved the central location 2 blocks from the Termini (train) Station. Neither of us spoke Italian but everyone was kind & helpful. We were there the end of May & the weather was perfect. We want to go back & Hotel Orlanda is where we will stay.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Wonderful hotel!! It is located close to Rome's train station, it was very convenient to find. Located in lovely old building. Staying there in late June 2003 during their oppressive heatwave!! (loved it nonetheless!).

reviews.title: Loved Hotel Orlanda
reviews.text: The rooms were really large and spacious, and very clean, with two YES two bathrooms located across the hall from us which were always spotless. The room rates were very reasonable as well. The breakfast was very nice consisting of pastries, rolls, cereals, juices, coffee, with a very nice breakfast host.

I booked all the hotels for a trip to Italy with my boyfriend. This hotel was very clean and spacious at a good price. We arrived around 10am in the morning from the airport, they greeted us and offered us coffee while we waited about 15 minutes for our room to be ready. I was very happy that we were able to check in to our room early. The staff was very nice and helpful. Also, we enjoyed the breakfast with a coffee machine you can choose a variety of coffees and croissants, toast, cereal, etc. My boyfriend really enjoyed the hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Rome from Hotel Orlanda

reviews.text: The only downside is that we stayed on the 5th floor which was a hike with our suitcases. If you climb the dome at St. Peter's the last thing you want to see when you get to your hotel is more stairs. LOL. I requested room 506 based on a recommendation from a book, which I can no longer remember the title.
reviews.title: Great base to explore Rome

reviews.text: The train station is nearby, which is great if you take the train from the airport. Also, both metro lines connect at the train station so this hotel is very accessible to anywhere in the city.
reviews.title: Great Value and Location
Horrendous exterior but a great value for money hotel
reviews.text: The price for a room is very good by Rome standards and you get a very clean hotel with all the facilities a tourist needs. Location is fantastic, just about all the sights are within walking distance and all tourist buses arrive and depart from the Termini - about 5 minutes walk away. The friendly staff all speak good English and are pleased to advise how to plan your trips around their beautiful city. To really enjoy your stay try and get a courtyard facing room because like all Rome's hotels the traffic noise is ever present. If going in summer the extra €5 for aircon is worth the money if you cannot sleep with the noise from the open window.

reviews.title: Excellent location
reviews.text: There is no restaurant but one excellent place to eat is Il Secchio Turn Right about 100 metres on first corner, it deserves all the praise it gets.

reviews.title: Problems with Orlanda Hotel
reviews.text: My friend and myself stayed at the Hotel Orlanda in September 2004. My daughter made the booking with the hotel in May giving her credit card details (as my friend and myself do not have credit card's). When we arrived we saw the lift only accommodates 1 person and a suitcase (also the lift was very old) so we decided to walk up the 4 flights of stairs (luggage included) to the hotel.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied with the Orlanda
reviews.text: We was given a cold welcome and given the keys to our rooms. The rooms were clean and adequate (for our 1 night stay). Next morning we had to go up to another hotel which was in the same building for breakfast, the breakfast was very nice.

reviews.title: I recommend it!
reviews.text: When we checked out we were told by a member of staff we had to pay for our nights stay. We explained that the rooms and payment had been payed for in May by my daughter with her credit card. We were told the credit card details my daughter gave only 'secures' the rooms and no payment is taken out. We both had to pay the bill useing our spending money. Luckly when we arrived back home and no money had been taken out of my daughters account to pay for the hotel. I cannot understand as to why the hotel does not explain this when asking for credit card details.

reviews.title: An ideal tourist base for Rome
reviews.text: I dont think we will be staying at the Orlanda again.

reviews.title: living in the city...
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Orlanda for 5 nights during a trip around Europe last fall. For us, with our heavy backpacks, it's location just around the corner from the train station was perfect. However, it was quite a walk to any sites of interest. Our room was always spotless and, by European standards, very large. The room looked as though it had been recently renovated and the photos on the hotel website are very accurate. After a long day, the hike up the many flights of stairs to the hotel was exhausting. (There was an elevator, but one look at it convinced us never to get inside.) The breakfast was very disappointing, but at least you could eat as much as you wanted. Both the coffee and orange juice came out of a machine and one morning, I ate what I am sure was the world's worst tasting croissant. (Although the staff were generally helpful and nice, the woman who worked in the breakfast room was always miserable.)

description: Located downtown, close Termini Station, Colosseum and Foro Romano, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps. Room with bath, shower, hairdryer, tv-sat, phone, safebox. Breakfast included. Wi-fi, internet point, laptop in room on request, all free. Sell romapass, open bus and Vatican Museum w/out linefree store luggages, map. Transfer from/to airport on request.
